name: Fleetyards
role_in_state: Primary naval shipbuilding, repair and ritual outfitting hub
economy_niches: salt-curing and fish packing for provisioning fleets
culture_adjustments: guild-contract norms override some harbor-clan protocols
practical, deadline-driven work rhythms supplant slower festival pacing
ritual practices focused on seaworthiness and voyage-luck integrated into yards
harbor-readers (practical augurists) hold civic sway over some ports
constraints: relies on imported ritual reagents and specialized timbers
limited arable land â€” provisioning dependent on maritime supply
long-range mind-influence and instant-revival magics banned in yards
notes: state naval contracts cause cyclical boom-and-bust labor demand
concentration of skilled artisans makes migration control a political issue
saltworks and curing houses clustered to serve fleet provisioning
